Module org.monarchinitiative.phenol.core
Package org.monarchinitiative.phenol.ontology.data

Interface Ontology

All Superinterfaces:
MinimalOntology, Serializable, Versioned
All Known Implementing Classes:
ImmutableOntology
public interface Ontology extends MinimalOntology, Serializable
Interface for most ontology implementations to implement.

This interface adds functions for easy access to ancestors to MinimalOntology.

Author:
Manuel Holtgrewe, Sebastian Koehler, Peter Robinson

  • Method Details

    • getPrimaryTermId

      default TermId getPrimaryTermId(TermId termId)
      Translate TermId to primary one (in case of alternative or deprecated term IDs).
      Parameters:
      termId - The TermId to translate.
      Returns:
      Primary TermId (might be the same as termId), null if none could be found.

    • getTermLabel

      default Optional<String> getTermLabel(TermId tid)

    • getAncestorTermIds

      default Set<TermId> getAncestorTermIds(TermId termId, boolean includeRoot)
      Return all the TermIds of all ancestors from termId.
      Parameters:
      termId - The TermId to query ancestor TermIds for.
      includeRoot - Whether or not to include the root.
      Returns:
      Set of TermIds of the ancestors of termId (including itself), an empty Set if termId is not a valid term ID in the ontology.

    • getAncestorTermIds

      default Set<TermId> getAncestorTermIds(TermId termId)
      Return all the TermIds of all ancestors from termId, including root.
      Parameters:
      termId - The TermId to query ancestor TermIds for.
      Returns:
      Set of TermIds of the ancestors of termId (including itself), including root.

    • getAllAncestorTermIds

      default Set<TermId> getAllAncestorTermIds(Collection<TermId> termIds, boolean includeRoot)
      Return all the TermIds of all ancestors from termIds.
      Parameters:
      termIds - Collection of TermIds to gather all parents except for the root.
      includeRoot - Whether or not to include the root's TermId
      Returns:
      Set of TermIds including all TermIds from termIds, including all ancestors.

    • getAllAncestorTermIds

      default Set<TermId> getAllAncestorTermIds(Collection<TermId> termIds)
      Return all the TermIds of all ancestors from termIds, including root.
      Parameters:
      termIds - Collection of TermIds to gather all parents except for the root.
      Returns:
      Set of TermIds including all TermIds from termIds, including all ancestors, including root.

    • getParentTermIds

      @Deprecated(forRemoval=true, since="2.0.2") default Set<TermId> getParentTermIds(TermId termId)
      Deprecated, for removal: This API element is subject to removal in a future version.
      use MinimalOntology.graph() to get an instance of OntologyGraph and then call OntologyGraph.getParents(Object, boolean). The method will be removed in 2.0.2.
      Return the TermIds of the parents of termId.
      Parameters:
      termId - The ID of the term to query the parents for.
      Returns:
      The resulting parent TermIds of termId.

    • subOntology

      @Deprecated(forRemoval=true, since="2.0.2") Ontology subOntology(TermId subOntologyRoot)
      Deprecated, for removal: This API element is subject to removal in a future version.
      the method's purpose is questionable, it is non-trivial to implement, and it is very likely that all the intended functionality can be implemented by working with iterators and other methods of the MinimalOntology. The method will be removed without replacement in 3.0.0.
      Construct and return sub ontology, starting from subOntologyRoot.
      Sub Ontology Iteration Remark

      The constructed sub ontology will use the same maps from TermId to T and same edge relation maps as the original ontology. However, the functions MinimalOntology.getAllTermIds(), MinimalOntology.getNonObsoleteTermIds(), MinimalOntology.getObsoleteTermIds(), and MinimalOntology.getTerms() will only contain the ids of the sub ontology. The term ID and relation maps might contain more elements in the case of creating sub ontologies and might refer to elements that are not present in the term id sets or the graph.

      Parameters:
      subOntologyRoot - TermId to use as root of sub ontology.
      Returns:
      Freshly created sub ontology.
